title: How much does it take for someone to get banned for INTing?
body:
I just got demoted after a ranked game because my top laner got tilted at the 2 minute mark and just ran it down the entire game. He ended up with a score of 1/14/2 in a 20:46 game. Will he get in trouble for this? Or does the 1 kill and 2 assists reset the "INTing detector"? He stopped INTing towards the end of the game which leads me to believe he knows his limits to stop before getting punished. But the whole lobby saw it and I believe he got at least 5 reports that game.

Edit: Since I've already had someone say "He was probably just having a bad game and couldn't do anything!"

After dying many times top lane, he went to bot lane as a level 4 (while everyone else was around lvl 8 at this point), then ran into their bot lane 3 times in a row. Even the enemy was in /all chat saying "Wow I feel bad for you guys I hope this guy gets banned." This was CLEAR intentional feeding. He kept saying "who cares" and "lol blame the sona"

replies.body:
Going 1/14/2 @ 20 minutes implying that they're bad and that justifies it.... I'll have to rethink about that one for a long hard while...  
Like let it sink in that, creep waves/minion waves start at like 1 minute and 30 seconds in. By this the guy would have to die almost every 45 seconds to maintain such an insanely hard k/d to achieve this. There's effort being put into a timely death of perfectly managing to get back to lane just to die within like a 5 second span, from walking to base to the middle of top lane. 

I'm pretty confident that he'll get away with it because I'm more than confident throughout the years that reports are based on merits such as how many times a person is reported it adds up to a total to then later trigger a punishment to the said player.  (This being said, it doesn't get manually reviewed or inspected, which wouldn't be too surprising or alarming to many). 

If you have concrete evidence as you say, you should probably go to the "Support Tab, Submit a Ticket" so it gets manually inspected, you can A) Provide your own evidence such as the ability during replays to record and highlight clips of this individual doing what they were doing, in this case intentional feeding. Provide it, open and close case. Player will most definitely be punished in this way. If it is how you say it is, and you have the overwhelming evidence as described.
Any tips on how to record the replay of the game? If a real Riot employee reviews the tape of that game there is absolutely zero question that he was intentionally feeding. It is clear as day.

> [{quoted}](name=Banned B4 Lv30,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ahvtUl67,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2019-11-07T22:20:06.084+0000)
>
> Any tips on how to record the replay of the game? If a real Riot employee reviews the tape of that game there is absolutely zero question that he was intentionally feeding. It is clear as day.

To download the replay of the match, it'll be within the 20 most recent games match history, and from there you can manually review the game, and it'll have in the options menu / list, a big red circle with a record icon on the left side of the games timeline of events, for like less than 20-30 seconds ideally would be too long to upload so gotta take quick snippets of the game. [Clicking on Profile -> Match History -> Scroll down till found -> Top Right -> Download -> Replay]
60-70 games on average.
[Just a string of losses bro](https://imgur.com/f8sysvC)

> [{quoted}](name=Creepy snek,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ahvtUl67,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2019-11-09T12:01:28.812+0000)
>
> [Just a string of losses bro](https://imgur.com/f8sysvC)

People have gotten away with worse than that.

Its not a score thing. It just takes a Rioter deeming it intentional when being reviewed. They (for obvious reasons) tend to err on the side of caution, so its always nice when I see posts here about an inter complaining about their ban. Dont expect to get your report reviewed immediately of course, as players here tend to report all sorts of shit as intentionally feeding. So theyre gonna have to go through a couple thousand bogus reports before they get to your report of an actual legitimate inter. (Int stands for intentional btw, so no need to capitalize it. Its just a shortened version of a whole word, not an acronym for something)

You keep capitalizing INT as if it's an acronym. It's not. It means **intentional**.

What part of what you've said proves they were intentionally dying to the enemy team to feed them? You must prove that they were intentionally doing it knowing that they were going to die and not simply making mistakes. It's perfectly possible for someone to get so far behind that they can't fight - them not seeing that and not realizing they're so far behind is not a punishable offense - it just means they're bad.

Are you okay? Did you read the post? He wasn't just "having a bad game" he literally ran it down top. Then when the bot lane told him to stop he went down to bot lane and ran into their turret 3 times in a row. It was CLEAR intentional feeding. What's your problem?

If he was "literally running it down" he'd have more than 14 deaths. Someone did a study in a custom game as to how fast you can die running it down.

Sure, he may have left lane and played in other lanes. That doesn't make it intentionally feeding.

You seem frustrated here and trying to blame others for your lack of climbing. If you feel it needs further looked at, submit a ticket to Riot. They will look at that player's account history and their behavior in games and use that to determine if it merits punishment or not.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ahvtUl67,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2019-11-07T22:13:21.532+0000)
>
> If he was "literally running it down" he'd have more than 14 deaths. Someone did a study in a custom game as to how fast you can die running it down.
> 
> Sure, he may have left lane and played in other lanes. That doesn't make it intentionally feeding.
> 
> You seem frustrated here and trying to blame others for your lack of climbing. If you feel it needs further looked at, submit a ticket to Riot. They will look at that player's account history and their behavior in games and use that to determine if it merits punishment or not.

I don't get what you're going at or trying to seemingly achieve? If a person intentionally feeds they aren't going to be straight up the most basic textbook run it down the lane as you would imagine. In this case, it's pretty close if you ask me. 45 seconds per each death seems quite remarkable. Also the whole study can be pretty plausible but can have flaws such as all champions have differences in their base movement speed when they start the game. Expecting an intentional feeder to have a perfect flawless k/d/a such as a death a minute, seems too detectable, too obvious. You gotta keep in mind many people know how to easily work around this. This isn't even going into specifics of how respawn timers are calculated by level, or time in the game. Unsure/uncertain of. I do not know.

> [{quoted}](name=SabrecIaw8,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ahvtUl67,comment-id=0001000000000001,timestamp=2019-11-07T22:20:36.235+0000)
>
> I don't get what you're going at or trying to seemingly achieve? If a person intentionally feeds they aren't going to be straight up the most basic textbook run it down the lane as you would imagine. In this case, it's pretty close if you ask me. 45 seconds per each death seems quite remarkable. Also the whole study pretty plausible and can have flaws such as all champions have differences in their base movement speed when they start the game. Expecting an intentional feeder to have a perfect flawless k/d/a such as a death a minute, seems too detectable, too obvious. You gotta keep in mind many people know how to easily work around this.

You also have to put into account death timers.
Death timer, whether or not they bought any kind of ms items including boots, abilities and tp..

Not to mention the fact that he didn't even get tilted and ran it down til about the 4-5 minute mark when he got his first death. Which makes it even more impressive that he was able to rack up 14 deaths in that time.

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ahvtUl67,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2019-11-07T22:13:21.532+0000)
>
> If he was "literally running it down" he'd have more than 14 deaths. Someone did a study in a custom game as to how fast you can die running it down.
> 
> Sure, he may have left lane and played in other lanes. That doesn't make it intentionally feeding.
> 
> You seem frustrated here and trying to blame others for your lack of climbing. If you feel it needs further looked at, submit a ticket to Riot. They will look at that player's account history and their behavior in games and use that to determine if it merits punishment or not.

"Git gud scrub" is not a useful sentiment to base a reply around when someone is frustrated with rule-breakers in their games (and hasn't broken the rules themselves).

So basically, in your eyes, intentional feeding is ONLY when a player IMMEDIATELY runs to the enemy base right after they respawn? Yikes. I hope this guy is on your team next time because he is CLEARLY not an intentional feeder!

I've  "literally run it down" and normally only end up with 10-15 deaths over 30 mins normally cuz I'm so over the game at that point I tab out while I'm dead and I'm not there to "run it down" RIGHT after respawn. I've "Run it down" by just afking under mid tower and actually got assists thanks to auto attack.

It's not always a bad game sometime people are just to too lazy to "run it down" T1 style.

Yeah, I could tell this guy was getting bored after a while. Because he would respawn and just chill in base for like a minute before running it down again. He also only "ran it down" like 4-5 times into the turrets, the other times he would just run into their team and intentionally pick 1v5 fights knowing he would get obliterated in 2 seconds.

A level 4 top laner doesn't just roam bot 3 times in a row and run into their turret. You are literally what is wrong with this community. You're probably the type of person that would report the people criticizing the intentional feeder for being "toxic".

If someone is inting, they're doing it to get a reaction. Of course I would report the people who are giving the inter what they want.

I would also report the inter. Because accurate reports are how someone gets punished.

How many kudos do you get for these from Rito? :D

I can not see any other reason to do this. Or are you simply trying to beat my downvote record? O.o
He's trying to get on Rito's good side! He wants a cookie :D
You only get banned for typing to your team
This is false. It is easiest to get banned for verbal comms, but not the only.

This made me curious and I actually went off to look up one of my old support tickets based on a group of inters in Flex Q. So I went back to find their names and. They are still active. I had posted their actions with times of when they had done this with screenshots tagged alongside. Definitely not a perma ban since they can still play. I am assuming or hoping that they did get some form of punishment though. But I can't tell for sure.
Riot does nothing unless they say a naughty word...
Unfortunately you are pretty much right. I don't think this guy is getting in trouble one bit.

It takes until **manual review** by a Rioter can confirm, beyond reasonable doubt, that it's inting.

They can't punish for just the score alone, *each game* needs a review. Even if they run Cleanse/Ghost on Nunu, that requires review, on the offchance that there *is* some legitimate justification for it.

Even if it's *clearly inting*, they still have to manually review, because if they ban someone because it *looked* like inting at first and it actually was legitimate but poor playing, it's going to be hell dealing with that mess. Because of that, it has to be thoroughly reviewed and they'll err on the side of caution.

And then they have to actually get to your particular game. Which can take ages, given how people report others for inting for some of the dumbest shit in the world.

>I believe he got at least 5 reports that game.

Number of reports is actually irrelevant. How *many* reports he got doesn't matter at all.

> [{quoted}](name=DuskDaUmbreon,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ahvtUl67,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2019-11-08T03:47:13.488+0000)
>
> It takes until **manual review** by a Rioter can confirm, beyond reasonable doubt, that it's inting.
> 
> They can't punish for just the score alone, *each game* needs a review. Even if they run Cleanse/Ghost on Nunu, that requires review, on the offchance that there *is* some legitimate justification for it.
> 
> Even if it's *clearly inting*, they still have to manually review, because if they ban someone because it *looked* like inting at first and it actually was legitimate but poor playing, it's going to be hell dealing with that mess. Because of that, it has to be thoroughly reviewed and they'll err on the side of caution.
> 
> And then they have to actually get to your particular game. Which can take ages, given how people report others for inting for some of the dumbest shit in the world.
> 
> Number of reports is actually irrelevant. How *many* reports he got doesn't matter at all.

I've seen cases on the boards that I doubt had time for a manual review (they make the post within an hour of the game that got them banned).

The automatic system is there, but for the most part the people who got caught by it don't come to the boards because it's usually extremely obvious what they were punished for.

Usually that case tends to have a history of inting, doesn't it?

However, there might be an automatic system in place to catch the most obvious cases (i.e. those that based on the KDA and timer cannot be anything *but* inting.

> [{quoted}](name=DuskDaUmbreon,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ahvtUl67,comment-id=000600000000,timestamp=2019-11-08T03:56:57.625+0000)
>
> Usually that case tends to have a history of inting, doesn't it?
> 
> However, there might be an automatic system in place to catch the most obvious cases (i.e. those that based on the KDA and timer cannot be anything *but* inting.

Honestly, the cases that I see pop up on the boards most often are from those that don't make a habit of intentional feeding.

This is pure conjecture; 

Given how we see cases where someone can chain intentionally feed and not get caught but still sometimes catch those that intentionally feed a single game I think that Riot takes into account what the \*normal\* playstyle/performance of the player is when the automatic system judges the account.

It would explain how someone could chain intentionally feed and get not get caught by the system. The account has been dedicated to trolling for so long that the system judged their intentional feeding as average performance for the player.
That...most definitely sounds like it's *a* theory. I'm not sure if it's a *good* one, but it's certainly *a* theory.

If you report them then they'll get punished. All of my reports have turned into punishments.

A couple things to keep in mind, though:

- Only one report will trigger the system to look into the game! That being said, it will count the number of games in which the person was reported, in order to check for consistent toxic behavior. Them consistently doing it is more likely to get them punished than it being a one-off thing.

- I'm not 100% sure if this is true, but I've been told you can talk to Riot Support about punishing users, if you remember the username. Just throw a ticket their way and see; not sure if it's correct, though.
